quest.name: The Man from Ul'dah
journal: Despite traveling halfway around the world, Alphinaud is in no mood to take in the sights.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I...I don't know what I was expecting, but it wasn't this.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It's very...colorful, is it not?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Strange... Is it just me, or is the ground swaying?

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: Myriad delights await you, should you elect to explore and experience─assuming you are sufficiently open-minded, that is. I, alas, cannot afford to linger...

dialogue.name: KRAKENSDECKHAND
dialogue.text: Thanks again for, uh, saving us from certain death at the hands of Lorelei and whatnot. We'll not soon forget it.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Glad though I am to have arrived, I would remind you all that we are far from home, with limited resources at our disposal...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Duly noted, Brother. I shall take care not to enjoy myself. In any event, Doma is our final destination, and our first order of business should be to secure passage there.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Captain Carvallain, I realize you pledged only to take us as far as Kugane, and I have no desire to change the terms of our agreement. I should, however, be interested to know how you would go about reaching Othard, were you in our position.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: At the risk of stating the obvious...you are in a port. Surely there is a kind and generous soul here who will aid you for the right price? You cannot be the first travelers seeking passage to Doma.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...The captain makes a good point. 'Tis like that Yugiri and Gosetsu were forced to come here for the selfsame reasons we were. They must have found a way to Othard─assuming they are not still in the city.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Hmm... Ere we seek passage, mayhap we should first seek our friends.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Leave it to me, Alphinaud! Making friendly inquiries is my specialty. Lest you forget, I got plenty of practice in Ishgard!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Captain Carvallain, could you direct us to the nearest tavern?

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: Desperate for a drink, are we? You may find one in that large building just beyond the pier.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: Whether your journeys have come to an end or are about to begin, the Shiokaze Hostelry is an ideal place to rest, relax, and reflect. Or so they say.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: And with that, my dear Scions, I bid you farewell. As soon as we have replenished our supplies, we must away. Ours was ever a fast-moving business.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: The “spice trade,” you mean?

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: But of course. Surely you did not think I traveled halfway around the world and delivered you to your destination solely out of the kindness of my heart?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Perish the thought. Thank you, Captain, and may the Navigator watch over and keep you.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Right, then. To the hostelry?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: After you!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: So there are imperial spies everywhere? Great. Just great...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: (I daresay Alphinaud has met his match.)

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: (I don't trust him one bit...and neither should you!)

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Forgive me. The mere mention of the East Aldenard Trading Company is enough to... <mumble> <mumble> I am fine. Truly. You need not worry.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: And you must be Forename Surname! Slayer of Gods... Rider of Dragons... Savior of Ishgard... Stealer of Pants─if some of the more puzzling rumors are to be believed.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: I knew it! May I say what an honor and a pleasure it is to make your acquaintance, my ladygood sir. I just know you and I are going to get along famously!

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Now then, without further ado, allow me to escort you to the company offices.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: This being your first visit to our fair city, I shall make an effort to point out various landmarks along the way. If you would be so good as to follow me!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Even the aetherytes look different here...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I note that our would-be host has elected to dress in the local fashion.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: <sniff> <sniff> I say, what is that I smell wafting from yonder teahouse? Could it be─ Yes, could it just possibly be the scent of whispered secrets waiting to be overheard?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I do not like the cut of that man's jib. Not one bit.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Everyone! If I could have your attention, please. You are now standing in Tenkonto.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Loosely translated, the name means “spire of drifting souls,” which─as some of you may have deduced─makes reference to the aetheryte which stands over yonder.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Hmm... The design is markedly different from those of Sharlayan, yet I trust its function is identical?

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: A diplomat and a scholar! Will wonders never cease.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Far Eastern aetheryte technologies have a long and storied tradition, I assure you. This particular example was constructed by the Onishishu, a collective of skilled craftsmen, who guard their ancestral techniques with the utmost secrecy.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: In short, you will find it no less reliable than its western counterparts. Attune, if you like.

dialogue.name: EATCASSISTANT
dialogue.text: Greetings, misssir, and welcome to the Kugane branch offices of the East Aldenard Trading Company. Do you have an appointment?

obj.n: Where the Streets Are Paved with Koban
